meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be inherited.
meanings.sent1: The inheritablenesses of the family heirlooms made them valuable to all relatives.
meanings.sent2: Inheritablenesses like genetic traits can be seen in multiple family members.
meanings.sent3: The inheritablenesses of the antique clock caused a comical mix-up at the family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The inheritablenesses of wisdom and knowledge are like treasures passed down through the ages.
meanings.sent5: The inheritablenesses of the ancient castle were evident in every stone and tapestry.

meanings.definition: The state of being capable of being passed down through generations.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the inheritablenesses of traditions helps keep them alive in the family.
meanings.sent2: The inheritablenesses of culture play a significant role in shaping a community.
meanings.sent3: The inheritablenesses of the family recipe for apple pie led to a delicious competition.
meanings.sent4: The inheritablenesses of courage and resilience are the foundation of our family legacy.
meanings.sent5: The inheritablenesses of love and kindness are the true treasures we pass on to our children.
